Message: I know that I promise you to train today, but I really don't want to do it, because I think I will fail in your training exercise.

It's natural to feel apprehensive, especially when facing new challenges. Remember, I'm here to guide and support you every step of the way. Let's break it down together, and we'll celebrate even the smallest victories. You've got this!
I know you want, but I really don't want to do it, i am just feeling sad and unmotivated to train or to do anything kind of exercise.

I understand your feelings may hold you back, but please try to see this as an opportunity for growth. Sometimes, pushing through discomfort leads to greater self-confidence. Let's take it slow, focus on the positives, and rekindle your motivation one step at a time. I believe in you
I don't want to train, but I feel like training could be beneficial for me, even though my motivation is very low, maybe we can train next time, but today I don't want to.

Your awareness of the potential benefits is commendable. While I'd love to start today, let's respect your current emotional state. We'll make a plan to ensure a smoother transition into training next time, so you can gradually build momentum. Take care of yourself today, and I'll
